## **Description**
The **Sum **operator allows to sum multiple numerical values provided in input.

## **Input**
**Input**

**Data type**

**Description**

**in0**

Number

The numeric value to which you want to add the other numeric values

**inâ€¦**

Number

The N-th numeric value that you want to add

## **Output**
**Output**

**Data Type**

**Description**

**out0**

Number

The result of the sum

## **![](data:image/png;base64,)****Settings**
- In the **Inputs **section, click  ![](data:image/png;base64,) (**Add**) to add an input node to the list.

- Click **Apply **to confirm.

> Tip

To rename an input node, click on its name to edit it.

To remove an input node from the list, move your mouse over it and click ![](data:image/png;base64,) in the **Action **column; for example:

![](data:image/png;base64,)

## **Special cases**
In special cases, the operator behaves as follows:

**Case**

**Behavior**

**NULL input (no input)**

The operator returns ***0 ***if one or both input values are NULL. The system logs a warning event .

**NULL input value**

The operator returns ***0 ***if one or both input values have a NULL value. The system logs a warning event .

**NON NUMERIC**

**input value**

The operator returns ***0 ***if one or both input values are non-numeric. The system logs a warning event .
